results.p: Aug 31, 2024 — The meaning of MUTATE is to undergo mutation. How to use mutate in a sentence.

results.t: MUTATE | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: to develop new physical characteristics because of a permanent change in the genes. These changes can happen naturally or can be produced by the use of ...
A mutation is a change in a DNA sequence. Mutations can result from DNA copying mistakes made during cell division, exposure to ionizing radiation, ...

results.t: MUTATED | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: Meaning of mutated in English ... to develop new physical characteristics because of a permanent change in the genes. These changes can happen naturally or can be ...
to cause (a gene, cell, etc.) to undergo an alteration of one or more characteristics: The disease mutates the retina's rod cells, and they slowly stop working.
To mutate is to change, especially genetically. When plants mutate, their genes change in a way that makes them look, grow, or reproduce differently.

results.t: Definition of mutate - NCI Dictionary of Cancer Terms
results.p: To change the genetic material of a cell. The changes (mutations) can be harmful, beneficial, or have no effect. Search NCI's Dictionary of Cancer Terms.

results.t: MUTATED Synonyms: 19 Similar and Opposite Words
results.p: Synonyms for MUTATED: changed, varied, shifted, fluctuated, morphed, metamorphosed, snapped, improved; Antonyms of MUTATED: stabilized, plateaued.

results.t: MUTATE definition and meaning | Collins English Dictionary
results.p: 8 days ago — If an animal or plant mutates, or something mutates it, it develops different characteristics as the result of a change in its genes.
In biology, a mutation is an alteration in the nucleic acid sequence of the genome of an organism, virus, or extrachromosomal DNA.
